text: Eric Junior Dina Ebimbe (born 21 November 2000) is a French professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for Ligue 1 club Dijon FCO, on loan from Paris Saint-Germain. == Club career == === Paris Saint-Germain === Developed in Paris Saint-Germain Academy, Dina-Ebimbe signed his first professional contract with Paris-Saint Germain in July 2018. He spent 2018–2019 season with the reserve team. He was an unused substitute for Ligue 1 game against Nantes on 17 April 2019. ==== Le Havre (loan) ==== On 5 July 2019, Le Havre announced that Dina-Ebimbe had joined the Ligue 2 side for a two-year loan deal. Three weeks later on 26 July, he made his professional debut in a 2–2 draw against Ajaccio. He scored his first professional goal on 30 August 2019, in a 3–0 win against Caen. ==== Dijon (loan) ==== On 6 July 2020, Ligue 1 side Dijon FCO announced the loan signing of Dina-Ebimbe with an option to buy. He made his debut on 22 August 2020, in a 0–1 defeat to Angers. == Personal life == Born in France, Dina-Ebimbe is of Cameroonian descent. == References == ==External links== * France profile at FFF Category:Living people Category:2000 births Category:Association football midfielders Category:Sportspeople from Seine- Saint-Denis Category:Paris Saint-Germain F.C. players Category:Le Havre AC players Category:Dijon FCO players Category:Ligue 2 players Category:Ligue 1 players Category:French footballers Category:French people of Cameroonian descent Category:Black French sportspeople
title: Eric Junior Dina-Ebimbe
